home.title: Summon
home.description: A lightweight reverse proxy that routes Claude Code API requests to different LLM providers based on model names. Maintains Anthropic subscription (OAuth) authentication while branching specific models to external providers.
home.settingsHint: Tip: Add ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL to ~/.claude/settings.json to skip specifying it on every launch. See Configuration for details.

routing.title: Model-Based Routing
routing.desc: Routes API requests to different providers based on the model field in /v1/messages POST requests.

auth.title: Subscription Auth Preserved
auth.desc: Keeps Anthropic OAuth tokens intact for default requests, swaps auth only for routed models.

streaming.title: SSE Streaming
streaming.desc: Full support for Server-Sent Events streaming with zero-copy passthrough.

transparent.title: Transparent Proxy
transparent.desc: Claude Code cannot detect the proxy's presence. All non-message requests pass through unchanged.

keyPool.title: API Key Pool
keyPool.desc: Load balance across multiple API keys with Least-Connections distribution and per-key concurrency limits.

fallback.title: Automatic Fallback
fallback.desc: Falls back to Anthropic API when external providers fail, ensuring continuous service.

cooldown.title: 429 Cooldown
cooldown.desc: Automatically applies cooldown to API keys that receive 429 errors, respecting Retry-After headers.

selfUpdate.title: Self-Update
selfUpdate.desc: Update to the latest version with a single command: summon update.

oneLine.title: One-Line Install (Recommended)
oneLine.wslNote: WSL uses the same Linux installer. You can use Claude Code from both inside WSL and Windows.

binary.title: Binary Download
binary.description: Download pre-built binaries from the GitHub Releases page.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: Configure Summon with a YAML config file.

multiUser.title: Multi-user Environment
multiUser.perUser: For each user to have their own configuration:
multiUser.system: For system administrators to provide default configuration:

location.title: Config File Location
location.description: Summon searches for config files in the following order:

approach1.title: Approach 1: Compatible Providers
approach1.description: For providers that natively understand Anthropic model names (e.g., Z.AI, Kimi). The original model name from Claude Code is forwarded as-is to the provider.
approach1.point1: The provider decides which actual model to use for the given Anthropic model name.
approach1.point2: Simple setup — no additional Claude Code configuration required.

approach2.title: Approach 2: Custom Model Binding
approach2.description: When you want to use a specific upstream model (e.g., glm-4.7 instead of whatever the provider maps claude-haiku to). Override model names in Claude Code's settings.json.
approach2.step1Desc: Override default model names in Claude Code's settings.json so it sends your preferred model names:
approach2.step2Desc: Match on the overridden model names in config.yaml:
approach2.envHaiku: Model name sent when Haiku tier is selected
approach2.envSonnet: Model name sent when Sonnet tier is selected
approach2.envOpus: Model name sent when Opus tier is selected
approach2.point1: You control exactly which upstream model the provider uses.
approach2.point2: ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL in settings.json means you can just run claude without extra env vars.
approach2.point3: The install script can configure this automatically.

fields.title: Field Reference
fields.server: Bind address and port. Use 127.0.0.1 for security (no external exposure).
fields.default: Default upstream URL for non-routed models and non-message requests (usually Anthropic API).
fields.routes: Array of routing rules evaluated top-to-bottom, first match wins.
fields.match: Substring match against the model field. If the model name contains this string, the route matches.
fields.authHeader: HTTP header name for authentication (e.g., x-api-key, Authorization).
fields.authValue: Authentication value. Supports ${VAR} environment variable references.
fields.authPool: Additional API key values for load distribution. Uses the same header as auth.header.
fields.concurrency: Per-key concurrent request limit. When all keys reach the limit, falls back to Anthropic (if fallback enabled) or returns 429.
fields.fallback: Whether to fall back to Anthropic API on provider failure (default: true).

keyPool.title: API Key Pool
keyPool.description: Some providers limit concurrent requests per API key (e.g., GLM-5 allows only 1 concurrent request per key). Register multiple API keys as a pool to increase total concurrency.
keyPool.rule1: Requests are distributed to the key with the fewest active connections (Least-Connections).
keyPool.rule2: Each key's concurrent usage is tracked and limited by the concurrency setting.
keyPool.rule3: When all keys reach their limit: fallback to Anthropic (if enabled) or return HTTP 429.
keyPool.rule4: Streaming responses automatically release the key when the stream ends.

env.title: Environment Variables
env.description: API keys should be stored as environment variables, not directly in config files. Use ${VAR_NAME} syntax to reference them.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: How to run Summon and connect Claude Code.

claudeCode.title: Claude Code Integration
claudeCode.description: Connect Claude Code to Summon by setting the ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL environment variable.

auto.title: Automatic Connection (settings.json)
auto.description: Add to Claude Code settings for automatic proxy connection on every launch.

modelBinding.title: Model Binding
modelBinding.description: Override Claude Code's default models to use external providers. The install script can configure this automatically.

cli.title: CLI Management
cli.description: Manage Summon from the command line.

update.title: Self-Update
update.description: Check for new releases and update the binary in place. Compares the current version against the latest GitHub release and prompts for confirmation.

commands.title: Direct Commands
commands.description: All management commands are top-level — no prefix needed.

configure.title: Interactive Menu
configure.description: Running summon configure opens an interactive menu with all available actions.

wsl.title: WSL Usage
wsl.description: Summon works in WSL. You can use Claude Code from both inside WSL and from Windows.

providers.title: Provider Guide
providers.description: Supported LLM providers and how to configure them.

kimi.description: Kimi provides an Anthropic-compatible API endpoint for coding tasks.

zai.description: Z.AI (GLM) provides an Anthropic-compatible API endpoint.

custom.title: Custom Provider
custom.description: Any Anthropic API-compatible provider can be added as a custom route.

note.title: Compatibility Note
note.description: v0.1 only supports Anthropic API-compatible providers. Non-compatible providers will be supported in v0.2 via request/response transformers.

providers.approach2Note: Requires ANTHROPIC_DEFAULT_*_MODEL override in ~/.claude/settings.json. See Configuration page for details.

routing.title: Routing Logic
routing.rule1: Only /v1/messages POST requests are inspected for the model field.
routing.rule2: Routes are evaluated top-to-bottom; the first match wins.
routing.rule3: match performs substring matching on the model name.
routing.rule4: Unmatched models are forwarded to the default upstream (Anthropic API).

service.title: Service Registration
service.description: Register Summon as a background service that starts automatically.

windows.title: Windows Service
windows.description: Two options: nssm (service wrapper) or Windows Task Scheduler.

thinking.title: Cannot resume Anthropic thinking models after switching to external model
thinking.description: Once a conversation uses an external provider's model, it cannot continue with Anthropic's thinking models (Claude Opus, Sonnet, etc.).
thinking.reason1: External providers are not fully compatible with Anthropic's native message format.
thinking.reason2: Thinking models depend on specific native fields and context structure.
thinking.reason3: External model responses don't meet the context format required by thinking models.

recommendation.title: Recommended Usage
recommendation.tip1: Within the same conversation, only switch between external models.
recommendation.tip2: Start a new conversation when you need Anthropic thinking models.

refused.title: Connection Refused
refused.description: Check that Summon is running and listening on the correct port.

timeout.title: Request Timeout
timeout.description: The upstream provider may be slow or unreachable. Check your network and provider status.

notFound.title: Config File Not Found
notFound.description: Ensure the config file exists in one of the search paths.

envVar.title: Environment Variable Not Resolved
envVar.description: Ensure environment variables referenced in config are set before starting Summon.

provider.title: Provider Issues
provider.description: If a provider returns errors, test the connection directly to isolate whether it's a Summon issue or a provider issue.

versions.v0_3_0:
Added
• Account-level concurrency limiting (account_concurrency)
• AccountSemaphore implementation (tokio::Semaphore-based)
• SemaphoreGuard pattern for automatic lifecycle management
• Semaphore acquisition timeout (500 minutes)
• Permit attachment across all response paths (including streaming)
• Automatic fallback on timeout
• Proactive 429 error prevention for account-level rate limited providers (e.g., BigModel)
• Stability improvements for concurrent Claude Code instances
versions.v0_2_8:
Added
• 429 (TOO_MANY_REQUESTS) response handling with API key cooldown
• Retry-After header parsing for cooldown duration
• Default 60-second cooldown when header is absent
• Automatic skip of cooldown keys during acquire
• WARN-level logging for cooldown events
versions.v0_2_7:
Added
• Fallback model name specification support

Fixed
• Minor bug fixes and stability improvements
versions.v0_2_6:
Added
• Interactive CLI menu (summon configure)
• Self-update command (summon update)
• Multi-language README support
versions.v0_2_0:
Added
• API key pool with Least-Connections distribution
• Per-key concurrency limits
• Fallback to Anthropic API on provider failure
• Request/response transformers for non-Anthropic providers
• Model name mapping (model_map field)
versions.v0_1_0:
Initial Release
• Model-based routing with substring matching
• Anthropic API passthrough for non-routed requests
• SSE streaming support
• YAML configuration with environment variable substitution
• GitHub Actions CI/CD for multi-platform releases
